event: Spanish explorer Juan de Bermúdez discovers the islands; they remain uninhabited.
English ship Sea Venture wrecks on Bermuda; survivors establish temporary settlement.
Permanent English settlement established; Bermuda becomes part of the Virginia Company colony.
Control of Bermuda transferred to the English Crown.
Hamilton becomes the capital, replacing St. George's.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire; enslaved people in Bermuda are emancipated.
U.S. establishes military bases in Bermuda during World War II under 99-year lease.
New constitution enacted; internal self-government established with a parliamentary system.
Referendum on independence from the UK fails; majority vote to remain a British territory.
British Overseas Territories Act grants Bermudians full British citizenship.
Bermuda reaffirms its status as a UK overseas territory in response to sovereignty debates.
COVID-19 pandemic impacts Bermuda’s tourism-dependent economy.
